item.title: Engineered for Simplicity: The Adaptable Coding Interview
item.description: When it comes to candidate technical tests when scaling out technology teams, it’s been said that there are no good solutions, only trade-offs - most of the accepted procedures in use at companies seem to just succeed in focussing in on the wrong things, or frustrating both the candidates and hiring teams in terms of the time commitment and hit rate of good hires. But what if there was a better way? A method that’s fair, efficient, and actually shows you how a candidate thinks and works?
